title: Russia Moves to Make Draft Evasion More Difficult
description: A new law would bar anyone called up to fight in Ukraine from leaving the country, among other restrictions, even as the Kremlin insists it is not planning a new conscription.

title: Biden to Celebrate Diplomacy, and His Own Irish Roots, in Belfast
description: President Biden will mark the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement in Northern Ireland before paying homage to his own Irish ancestry.

title: Macron Returns From China to Allied Dismay
description: Criticism of the French president’s performance in Beijing has been scathing among some allies, who saw him as cozying up to Beijing.

title: Russia Moves to Tighten Rules on Avoiding a Military Draft
description: Russian lawmakers voted in favor of new measures that would make it much harder to avoid a troop mobilization. Here is what we’re covering:

title: Leadership of Foundation Honoring Justin Trudeau’s Father Quits
description: The Pierre Elliott Trudeau Foundation said that accusations of Chinese meddling in its affairs had made it impossible for it to function as before.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: A Gloomy Economic Forecast
description: Also, Myanmar’s junta killed more than 100 in a major airstrike.

title: Paul Whelan Calls Home For the First Time In Nearly Two Weeks, Family Says
description: Mr. Whelan, a former Marine, has been serving a 16-year sentence in Russia on what the United States says are fabricated charges of espionage.

title: Egypt Denies Report on Leaked Document That Said It Planned to Ship Arms to Russia
description: The Washington Post said the document describes an Egyptian plan to secretly produce rockets, artillery rounds and gunpowder for Russia.

title: Volcano Erupts in Russia, Spewing Ash Into the Stratosphere
description: The eruption of Shiveluch, on a remote peninsula in eastern Russia, sent a giant cloud of debris into the sky and smothered villages in a thick layer of brown volcanic dust.

title: White House Suggests Colorado River Cuts Be Spread Evenly Among States
description: As the river shrinks, the Biden administration is getting ready to impose, for the first time, reductions in water supplies to states.

title: French Police Face Scrutiny for Heavy Hand During Pension Protests
description: An audio recording of officers threatening and intimidating young people has reignited a debate over harsh and discriminating tactics.

title: Airstrike in Rebel-Held Region of Myanmar Kills at Least 100
description: It was the junta’s deadliest attack since seizing power in 2021. As resistance forces have become better armed, the military has doubled down on its strategy of carrying out air raids and targeting civilians.

title: During Ramadan, Palestinians Picnic in Aqsa Compound to Break Fast
description: A coveted Middle Eastern rice dish has become a social media star at Al Aqsa Mosque, even as tensions escalate at a site also revered by Jews.

title: U.S. Declares WSJ Reporter Evan Gershkovich ‘Wrongfully Detained’ by Russia
description: The finding means that the U.S. government sees the Wall Street Journal reporter as the equivalent of a political hostage.

title: The Military’s Leaked Secrets
description: Officials are worried that leaked documents could damage U.S. operations around the world.

title: How Ukraine Won the War to Keep the Lights On
description: Russia was determined to break Ukrainians’ will by plunging them into cold and darkness. But the long winter is almost over.

title: Amid Furor, Seoul Downplays Leaked Pentagon Documents
description: As opposition lawmakers in South Korea accuse Washington of spying, President Yoon Suk Yeol has tried to minimize the significance of the breach.

title: In China, Young People Ditch Prestige Jobs for Manual Labor
description: Some people who’ve walked away from China’s grueling corporate culture say it’s worth the financial sacrifice. “I was tired of living like that,” one said.

title: Online clues may narrow the search for the leaker of Pentagon war documents, U.S. officials say.
Ukrainian soldiers practice a dangerous art: Finding Russian mines.
description: Finding Russian mines has become a dangerous art for

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: The investigation into leaked Ukraine war documents.

title: For Biden, an Era When Treaties Are More Likely to Be Broken Than Brokered
description: The president’s trip to Northern Ireland will mark the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, which ended decades of violence. But such breakthroughs are harder to achieve in today’s fractious world.

title: Mexico Charges 4 Soldiers in Killings of 5 Civilians in Border City
description: The shooting deaths, in the cartel-dominated city of Nuevo Laredo, caused outrage because the people the soldiers fired on had apparently been unarmed.
